name: corelist
description: Perl 核心模块查询工具，用于查看 Perl 核心模块的包含版本、发布信息及相关特性。
syntax:
corelist -v,
corelist [-a|-d] <ModuleName> | /<ModuleRegex>/ [<ModuleVersion>] ...,
corelist [-v <PerlVersion>] [ <ModuleName> | /<ModuleRegex>/ ] ...,
corelist [-r <PerlVersion>] ...,
corelist --utils [-d] <UtilityName> [<UtilityName>] ...,
corelist --utils -v <PerlVersion>,
corelist --feature <FeatureName> [<FeatureName>] ...,
corelist --diff PerlVersion PerlVersion,
corelist --upstream <ModuleName>

options.description: lists all versions of the given module (or the matching modules, in case you used a module regexp) in the perls Module::CoreList knows about
finds the first perl version where a module has been released by date, and not by version number (as is the default)

Given two versions of perl, this prints a human-readable table of all module changes between the two. The output format may change in the future, and is meant for humans, not programs. For programs, use the Module::CoreList API
help! help! help! to see more help, try --man
all of the help

lists all of the perl release versions we got the CoreList for. If you pass a version argument (value of $], like 5.00503 or 5.008008), you get a list of all the modules and their respective versions. (If you have the "version" module, you can also use new-style version numbers, like 5.8.8.) In module filtering context, it can be used as Perl version filter
lists all of the perl releases and when they were released. If you pass a perl version you get the release date for that version only

lists the first version of perl each named utility program was released with. May be used with -d to modify the first release criteria. If used with -v <version> then all utilities released with that version of perl are listed, and any utility programs named on the command line are ignored
lists the first version bundle of each named feature given
Shows if the given module is primarily maintained in perl core or on CPAN and bug tracker URL

name: perlbug
description: 用于生成关于perl5及其附带模块的bug报告或感谢信的工具
syntax: perlbug [-v] [-a address] [-s subject] [-b body | -f inpufile ] [ -F outputfile ] [-r returnaddress] [-e editor] [-c adminaddress | -C] [-S] [-t] [-h] [-p patchfile ] perlbug [-v] [-r returnaddress] [-ok | -okay | -nok | -nokay]

options.description: Include Verbose configuration data in the report
File containing the body of the report
File containing a patch or other text attachment (separate multiple files with commas)
File to output the resulting report to (defaults to 'perlbug.rep')
Save or send the report without asking for confirmation
Send the report to this address, instead of saving to a file
Address to send copy of report to (defaults to 'root@8e660ce0d05e.nonet')
Don't send copy to administrator
Subject to include with the report
Body of the report
Your return address
Editor to use
Test mode
Thank-you mode (target address defaults to 'perl-thanks@perl.org')
Data mode (prints out configuration data without mailing anything)
Report successful build on this system to perl porters
As -ok but allow report from old builds
Report unsuccessful build on this system to perl porters
As -nok but allow report from old builds
Print this help message

name: perldoc
description: Perl 文档浏览器
syntax:
perldoc [options] PageName|ModuleName|ProgramName|URL...
perldoc [options] -f BuiltinFunction
perldoc [options] -q FAQRegex
perldoc [options] -v PerlVariable

options.description: Display this help message
Report version
Recursive search (slow)
Ignore case
Display pod using pod2text instead of Pod::Man and groff (-t is the default on win32 unless -n is specified)
Display unformatted pod text
Display module's file in its entirety
Specify replacement for groff
Display the module's file name
Don't attempt to drop privs for security
Arguments are file names, not modules (implies -U)
Verbosely describe what's going on
Send output to STDOUT without any pager
output_filename_to_send_to
output_format_name
FormatterModuleNameToUse
formatter_option:option_value
translation_code   Choose doc translation (if any)
Use index if present (looks for pod.idx at /data/service/hnp/perl.org/perl_5.42.0/lib/5.42.0/aarch64-linux)
Search the text of questions (not answers) in perlfaq[1-9]
Search Perl built-in functions
Search Perl API
Search predefined Perl variables

name: perlivp
description: Perl 安装验证程序

options.description: Print a preface before each test telling what it will test.
Verbose mode in which extra information about test results is printed.  Test failures always print out some extra information regardless of whether or not this switch is set.
Prints this help message.

name: perlthanks
description: 生成关于 perl5 及其附带模块的感谢信或错误报告的工具
syntax:
perlthanks [-v] [-a address] [-s subject] [-b body | -f inpufile ] [ -F outputfile ] [-r returnaddress] [-e editor] [-c adminaddress | -C] [-S] [-t] [-h] [-p patchfile ]
perlthanks [-v] [-r returnaddress] [-ok | -okay | -nok | -nokay]

options.description: Include Verbose configuration data in the report
File containing the body of the report. Use this to quickly send a prepared report.
File containing a patch or other text attachment. Separate multiple files with commas.
File to output the resulting report to. Defaults to 'perlthanks.rep'.
Save or send the report without asking for confirmation.
Send the report to this address, instead of saving to a file.
Address to send copy of report to. Defaults to 'root@8e660ce0d05e.nonet'.
Don't send copy to administrator.
Subject to include with the report. You will be prompted if you don't supply one on the command line.
Body of the report. If not included on the command line, or in a file with -f, you will get a chance to edit the report.
Your return address. The program will ask you to confirm this if you don't give it here.
Editor to use.
Test mode.
Thank-you mode. The target address defaults to 'perl-thanks@perl.org'.
Data mode. This prints out your configuration data, without mailing anything. You can use this with -v to get more complete data.
Report successful build on this system to perl porters (use alone or with -v). Only use -ok if *everything* was ok: if there were *any* problems at all, use -nok.
As -ok but allow report from old builds.
Report unsuccessful build on this system to perl porters (use alone or with -v). You must describe what went wrong in the body of the report which you will be asked to edit.
As -nok but allow report from old builds.
Print this help message.

piconv -l
piconv -r encoding_alias
piconv -h

options.description: lists all available encodings
resolve encoding to its (Encode) canonical name
when omitted, the current locale will be used
when omitted, the current locale will be used
"string" will be the input instead of STDIN or files
check the validity of the input
show debug information
use the scheme for conversion
transliterate characters missing in encoding to \x{HHHH} where HHHH is the hexadecimal Unicode code point
transliterate characters missing in encoding to \x{HHHH} where HHHH is the hexadecimal Unicode code point
transliterate characters missing in encoding to &#NNN; where NNN is the decimal Unicode code point
transliterate characters missing in encoding to &#xHHHH; where HHHH is the hexadecimal Unicode code point

name: pl2pm
description: 将 Perl 脚本（.pl)转换为 Perl 模块（.pm)的工具,自动处理包声明、子程序提取、POD 文档格式转换，简化脚本模块化流程

name: pod2html
description: 将 POD 格式文档转换为 HTML 的工具

options.description: turn =head1 directives into links pointing to the top of the page (off by default).
do not turn =head1 directives into links pointing to the top of the page.
directory for the directory cache files.
stylesheet URL
flushes the directory cache.
produce block header/footer.
do not produce block header/footer (default).
prints this message.
directory for resulting HTML files.
http-server base directory from which all relative paths in podpath stem (default is /).
generate an index at the top of the resulting html (default behaviour).
do not generate an index at the top of the resulting html.
filename for the pod to convert (input taken from stdin by default).
filename for the resulting html file (output sent to stdout by default).
include a POD ERRORS section in the output if there were any POD errors in the input (default behavior).
do not include a POD ERRORS section in the output.
colon-separated list of directories containing library pods (empty by default).
filesystem base directory from which all relative paths in podpath stem (default is .).
suppress some benign warning messages.
do not suppress some benign warning messages (default).
recurse on those subdirectories listed in podpath (default behaviour).
do not recurse on those subdirectories listed in podpath.
title that will appear in resulting html file.
self-explanatory.
self-explanatory (off by default).

name: pod2man
description: 将 POD 格式文档转换为 man 页面的工具

options.description: Sets the centered page header for the ".TH" macro to string. The default is "User Contributed Perl Documentation", but also see --official below.

Set the left-hand footer string for the ".TH" macro to string. By default, the first of POD_MAN_DATE, SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH, the modification date of the input file, or the current date (if input comes from "STDIN") will be used, and the date will be in UTC.
Specifies the encoding of the output. encoding must be an encoding recognized by the Encode module. The default on non-EBCDIC systems is UTF-8.

Set the error handling style. "die" says to throw an exception on any POD formatting error. "stderr" says to report errors on standard error, but not to throw an exception. "pod" says to include a POD ERRORS section in the resulting documentation summarizing the errors. "none" ignores POD errors entirely, as much as possible. The default is "die".
The fixed-width font to use for verbatim text and code. Defaults to "CW". Some systems may want "CR" instead. Only matters for troff output.
Bold version of the fixed-width font. Defaults to "CB". Only matters for troff output.
Italic version of the fixed-width font. Defaults to "CI". Only matters for troff output.
Bold italic version of the fixed-width font. Defaults to "CB". Only matters for troff output.

Allows turning off some default formatting rules based on guesswork. The special rule "all" enables all guesswork. "none" disables all. Otherwise, a comma-separated list of "functions", "manref", "quoting", "variables".
Set the name of the manual page for the ".TH" macro to name. Overrides any automatic determination of the name.
Suppresses the URL when anchor text is given in L<> formatting codes.
Set the default header to indicate that this page is part of the standard Perl release, if --center is not also given.
Set the centered footer for the ".TH" macro to version. By default, this is set to the version of Perl you run pod2man under.
Set the section for the ".TH" macro. Defaults to 1 unless the file ends in ".pm", in which case section 3 will be selected.
Sets the quote marks used to surround C<> text to quotes. If quotes is a single character, it is used as both the left and right quote. Otherwise, it is split in half.
Sets the left quote mark used to surround C<> text.
Sets the right quote mark used to surround C<> text.
Equivalent to "--errors=stderr". Supported for backward compatibility.
This option is now ignored as UTF-8 is the default output encoding.
Print out the name of each output file as it is being generated.
Print out usage information.

name: pod2text
description: 将 POD 格式文档转换为纯文本的工具
syntax:
pod2text [-aclostu] [--code] [-e encoding] [--errors=style] [--guesswork=rule[,rule...]] [-i indent] [-q quotes] [--nourls] [--stderr] [-w width] [input [output ...]]
pod2text -h

options.description: Use an alternate output format with different heading style and colon-marked =item entries
Same as -a: alternate output format
Include non-POD text from input file in output (preserves code with rendered POD)
Format output with ANSI color escape sequences (requires Term::ANSIColor)
Same as -c: ANSI color formatting
Specify output encoding (recognized by Encode module); unrepresentable chars handled per --errors
Same as -e: set output encoding
Set error handling style: die (default), stderr, pod, or none
Enable/disable guesswork formatting rules: all (default), none, or quoting
Set spaces for regular text indent and default =over block indent (default: 4)
Same as -i: set indentation spaces
Print usage information and exit
Same as -h: show help message
Print blank line after =head1 headings (recommended for arbitrary text documents)
Same as -l: add blank line after =head1
Set left margin width (default: 0; applies to all text including headings)
Same as -m: set left margin width
Same as -m: set left margin width
Suppress URLs in L<> formatting codes when anchor text is present
Format output with overstrike (bold/italics via backspace sequences)
Same as -o: overstrike formatting
Set quote marks for C<> text (single char = both quotes; split 2-part string)
Same as -q: set C<> quote marks
Preserve two-space sentence endings (compresses whitespace otherwise)
Same as -s: preserve two-space sentence endings
Equivalent to --errors=stderr (report errors to STDERR without aborting)
Use termcap for terminal width/bold/underline (requires Term::Cap and termios)
Same as -t: termcap-based terminal formatting
Set output encoding to UTF-8 (equivalent to --encoding=UTF-8)
Same as -u: UTF-8 output encoding
Set right-hand text wrap column (default: 76; adjusted for -t)
Same as -w: set text wrap width
Same as -w: set text wrap width

name: pod2usage
description: 从 POD 文档中提取并格式化使用信息的工具
syntax: pod2usage [-help] [-man] [-exit exitval] [-output outfile] [-verbose level] [-pathlist dirlist] [-formatter module] [-utf8] file

options.description: Prints a brief help message and exit.
Prints this command's manual page and exit.
The exit status value to return.
The output file to print to. Use "-", ">&1", or ">&STDOUT" for standard output; ">&2" or ">&STDERR" for standard error.
Set verbosity level: 1 (SYNOPSIS only), 2 (SYNOPSIS + OPTIONS/ARGUMENTS), 3 (entire manpage).
Directories to search for input file (separated by ":" on Unix, ";" on Windows).
Text formatter to use (default: Pod::Text; e.g., Pod::Text::Termcap).
Enable UTF-8 output (requires formatter support for "utf8" option).

name: podchecker
description: 检查 POD 文档语法正确性的工具

options.description: Print a brief help message and exit.
Print the manual page and exit.
Do not print a success message.
Turn on printing of warnings; repeating increases warning level (level 2 flags unescaped "<,>" characters).
Turn off printing of warnings.

name: ptar
description: Perl 编写的类 tar 归档工具（基于 Archive::Tar 模块，支持创建、提取、列出 tar 归档文件）

ptar -c [-v] [-z] [-C] [-T index | -] [-f ARCHIVE_FILE | -]
ptar -x [-v] [-z] [-f ARCHIVE_FILE | -]
ptar -t [-z] [-f ARCHIVE_FILE | -]

options.description: Create ARCHIVE_FILE or STDOUT (-) from FILE
Extract from ARCHIVE_FILE or STDIN (-)
List the contents of ARCHIVE_FILE or STDIN (-)
Name of the ARCHIVE_FILE to use. Default is './default.tar'
Read/Write zlib compressed ARCHIVE_FILE (not always available)
Print filenames as they are added or extracted from ARCHIVE_FILE
Prints this help message
CPAN mode - drop 022 from permissions
Get names to create from file

Boolean option (backward compatibility support)
Boolean option (backward compatibility support)

name: ptargrep

options.description: When matching files are extracted, ignore the directory path from the archive and write to the current directory using the basename of the file from the archive.
Same as --basename
Make pattern matching case-insensitive.
Same as --ignore-case
Print the pathname of each matching file from the archive to STDOUT. Without this option, the default behaviour is to extract each matching file.
Same as --list-only
Log debugging info to STDERR.
Same as --verbose

Same as --help

name: shasum
description: SHA 校验和工具，用于计算或验证文件的 SHA 哈希值（支持多种 SHA 算法）

options.description: Specify hash algorithm: 1 (default), 224, 256, 384, 512, 512224, 512256
Read in binary mode
Read SHA sums from the FILEs and check them
Create a BSD-style checksum
Read in text mode (default)
Read in Universal Newlines mode; produces same digest on Windows/Unix/Mac
Read in BITS mode; ASCII '0' interpreted as 0-bit, ASCII '1' as 1-bit, other characters ignored
Don't fail or report status for missing files (useful only when verifying)
Don't print OK for each successfully verified file (useful only when verifying)
Don't output anything; status code shows success (useful only when verifying)
Exit non-zero for improperly formatted checksum lines (useful only when verifying)
Warn about improperly formatted checksum lines (useful only when verifying)

name: splain
description: Perl 错误解释工具，用于简化和解释 Perl 脚本的错误提示信息

options.description: Option with argument (see perldoc for details)
Boolean option (no argument, see perldoc for details)
Boolean option (no argument, see perldoc for details)
Boolean option (no argument, see perldoc for details)
Stop processing of options, subsequent content as program arguments

name: streamzip
description: 将标准输入流压缩为Zip容器，并输出到标准输出或写入指定文件。
syntax: producer | streamzip [OPTIONS] | consumer, producer | streamzip [OPTIONS] -zipfile output.zip

options.description: Write zip container to the filename 'F'. Outputs to stdout if zipfile not specified.
Set member name to 'M' [Default '-']
Set compression level for Deflate [Default: 6]
Create a Zip64-compliant zip file [Default: No]. Enable Zip64 if input is greater than 4Gig.
Force a streamed zip file when 'zipfile' option is also enabled. Only applies when 'zipfile' option is used. [Default: No]. Stream is always enabled when writing to stdout.

Compress using method 'M'. Valid methods are store (Store without compression), deflate (Use Deflate compression [Default]), bzip2 (Use Bzip2 compression), lzma (Use LZMA compression [needs IO::Compress::Lzma]), xz (Use LZMA compression [needs IO::Compress::Xz]), zstd (Use LZMA compression [needs IO::Compress::Zstd])
Display version number [1.00]

name: xsubpp
description: Perl XS 代码预处理器（eXtended Subroutine Preprocessor）

options.description: Enable verbose mode, output additional processing information
Specify suffix for C output files (default: .c)
Generate exception checking code
Generate function prototypes in the output C code
Disable Perl version checking during processing
Exclude line number information from generated C code
Disable code optimization, generate more readable (but potentially less efficient) C code
Do not generate automatic handling code for IN/OUT parameters
Do not generate parameter type checking code
Strip comments and blank lines from the generated C code
Specify additional typemap file for Perl/C data type conversion rules

name: zipdetails
description: 显示ZIP文件的内部结构和元数据信息

options.description: Display help
Hide filename and payload data in the output
Enable pessimistic scanning mode. Blindly scan the file looking for zip headers. Expect false-positives.
Display date/time fields in UTC. Default is local time
Enable verbose mode -- output more stuff
Print zipdetails version number. This is version 4.004
Enable optimistic scanning mode. Blindly scan the file looking for zip headers. Expect false-positives.
Use encoding "e" when reading filename/comments from the zip file. Uses system encoding ("utf-8-strict") by default
Disable filename & comment encoding. Default disabled.
Use encoding "e" when writing filename/comments to the display. Uses system encoding ("utf-8-strict") by default
Display extra info when a filename/comment encoding has changed
Enable/disable support for the zip file "Language Encoding" flag. When this flag is set in a zip file the filename/comment is assumed to be encoded in UTF8. Default is enabled
Enable/disable all info/warning/error messages. Default enabled.
Enable/disable exit status bitmask for messages. Default disabled. Bitmask values are Info 1, Warning 2, Error 4
